citation.article-title: Some characteristics of Methylococcus mobilis sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Methylococcus mobilis sp. nov.
Methylococcus mobilis (mobilis Masculine Latin adjective mobilis - motile)
Coccoid cells, 0.8-1.2 μm, mainly mono- and diplococci, chains of cocci and tetrads, sometimes slightly oval.
Motile by a polar flagellum under some conditions.
Colonies on agar: white, circular, regular margins, about 2 mm in diameter after 2 weeks incubation in methane-air.
Segregation into R- and S-forms.
Liquid culture homogeneous, sometimes flocculating, no water-soluble pigment released.
Resting stages : cysts and multiple-bodied cysts which resemble refractile sarcina-like packets, surrounded by a slime capsule.
Optimal growth on methane in mineral salts medium.
Poor growth on 0.1% methanol, better on methanol vapour.
In addition to nitrate and ammonia, assimilation of peptone, yeast extract, asparagine, aspartic acid and glutamate as sources of nitrogen.
No fixation of atmospheric nitrogen.
Methane assimilated via the hexulose-monophosphate pathway.
Low activity of hydroxypyruvate reductase, α-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase is absent.
In addition to type I intracytoplasmic embranes, tube-like structures of unknown function were observed in cells grown in the presence of peptone.
Poly-β-hydroxybutyric acid was absent.
Oxidation of non-growth substrates such as alcohols, aldehydes (not acetaldehyde) and formic acid occurred.
Growth temperature 22-37°C, optimum at 30°C.
G + C content of DNA: 56.3±0.4 moles%.
Isolated from activated sludge.
Type strain: LMD 77.28.
